thread.title: Pet food bank demand on the rise in Ottawa | CTV News
thread.title_full: Pet food bank demand on the rise in Ottawa | CTV News

author: @ctvottawa
title: Pet food bank demand on the rise in Ottawa | CTV News
text: Many people consider pets to be part of the family, and affordability challenges can create problems filling bowls on the floor as much as they do filling plates on the table. The Ottawa Humane Society (OHS) operates a pet food bank at its West Hunt Club headquarters. Pop-up locations operate regularly as well. OHS president and CEO Sharon Miko tells Newstalk 580 CFRA's Ottawa at Work with Patricia Boal demand for the service continues to grow. More information is available online. But when the couple looked around, they say a pack of eight coyotes surrounded them, picked Kahlua up and ran off with him. A Canadian airline is changing its check-in deadline for all flights. Here's why Travellers will have to check in 15 minutes earlier than usual according to Air Canada's new cutoff time for all flights.
